intro: Rosa recurva, commonly known as the recurved rose, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive recurved petals and thorny stems, which are typical features of many rose species. Native to parts of Asia, particularly China, it thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. The plant produces fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and horticultural collections.
